subject: Update on intelligent Senior QS Font.
msgSnippet: Just because it s the kind of gearhead I am, I ve been researching what I suggested before -- a font that would automatically produce Senior QS while the user
messageBody:
Just because it's the kind of gearhead I am, I've been researching
what I suggested before -- a font that would automatically produce
Senior QS while the user types as if writing Junior QS.

It turns out that I'm at the leading edge of font design. While the
OpenType font standard does support this kind of thing, currently
very few applications support all the properties of an OpenType font.

( http://www.myfonts.com/info/opentype-support-in-applications/ )

The upshot is that the only applications that would consistently
display an OpenType QuickScript (OTQS?) font as designed are Adobe
InDesign or Adobe PhotoShop.

There are various shenanigans that I might pull to make Microsoft
Word also display an OTQS properly, but ultimately I am very
disappointed in these people. :P

Older font types, such as TrueType, still seem to me to have the
possibility for this kind of scripting, but making it actually work
is beyond me.
